Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the Rough”
Reviews.Author: TreeTopCrow
Reviews.Content: They are just completing a renovation that brings this "hotel for the movie stars" into the 21st century. The flavor of the old days on El Cajon Boulevard hangs in the air. Unusually large rooms, decently if simply appointed, make this a comfortable place to stay at a good price. Maybe best of all is that there are three really special restaurants right across the street. Convenient to everything.

Reviews.Title: “More than expected for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Nina1983
Reviews.Content: We stayed here due to the high price of hotels downtown - and it didn't disappoint. Our poolside room was spacious and although we didn't actually use the pool due to time constraints it seemed well frequented and was open long hours. The public rooms were nicely decorated and staff very friendly. Free parking a bonus and very close to the rooms. Location would be the downside as it is a little out of the centre, but only a 15 min bus ride or 15 dollar taxi ride.

Reviews.Title: “Recently updated in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Buzzhombre
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at The Lafayette Hotel for many years. It used to be part of the Inn-Suites chain. It's located along El Cajon Blvd. between North Park and Normal Heights. It's a short drive from Balboa Park and the San Diego Zoo, and not too far from the beach. They've been renovating the place over the last couple of years, and I question some of the decisions they've made. They've removed refrigerators and microwaves from many of the rooms, they removed the hot tub, and some of the decor is a bit stark, but the new beds are very comfortable, and the rooms now come with a flat screen TV and a clock-radios that has an iPod dock. I had an extended email conversation with the manager on some of the decisions. They are still (as of March, 2012) renovating the restaurant/bar/breakfast room, so they serve the breakfast in the very large lobby. It is very interesting--more like a European continental breakfast--with cheese and fruit and little muffins and croissants. There's an Olympic sized swimming pool in the center courtyard. It's a large, historic hotel that occupies an entire city block. Each room in the main building is named after a celebrity (mostly movie stars) from the past. They have free parking in two outdoor lots and an indoor lot in the basement. Room rates seem to have gone up recently, as the renovation progressed, but it's still a good value compared to other hotels in the area. In the northeast corner of the building is The Red Fox restaurant and bar. It is truly something out of the past, with a wooden interior allegedly brought over from England. The restaurant specialized in steaks, but they also have other entrees, and the prices are not outrageous. The adjacent bar has live music every night, sort of an amateur open-mike Karaoke, with most of the performers being old-time regulars. The music is mostly old standards from the 30s through the 50s. The Red Fox is worth a visit. There are also other restaurants in the area, especially in Hillcrest (near 6th & University) and in North Park (near 30th & University).

Reviews.Title: “A San Diego classic”
Reviews.Author: Massimo1
Reviews.Content: As I know San Diego quite well, I chose the Lafayette for the reasons of price, location, free parking and free wifi. It is a historic hotel in a nice residential neighborhood, near restaurants, and away from the I-8 (Mission Valley) where a lot of the motels are or downtown where parking is impossible or very expensive. Nevertheless, freeway access is close by. The price was moderate for a small but comfy room with a large bathroom, plenty of electrical outlets, and flat screen TV. It's not luxurious, but it is worth the money. I would recommend it to anyone not interested in a motel and not willing to overpay for the downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfy”
Reviews.Author: Red_26101
Reviews.Content: It was just remodeled - very nicely done. Very comfortable bed and I've stayed in luxury hotels in Vegas - comfort level was the same which is amazing for half the price. Flat screen and ipod docking station. Staff was nice and helpful. Parking is gated underneath the hotel. Great location - safe neighborhood and near some really good restaurants. It was also close to all the major attractions of San Diego. Would definitely stay again. Only problem - wifi didn't work so we had to go to a Starbucks...thank goodness they're on every corner, right!

Reviews.Title: “Worked well for our family of 4”
Reviews.Author: sunseeker1062
Reviews.Content: We had a family suite: 2 large bedrooms (one with a bunkbed which the kids loved), 2 washrooms and 2 closets. There was a fridge and coffeemaker but no microwave. Both rooms had flatscreen TVs, and there was a small dining area. Breakfast was not included, parking was. Our room did not overlook the pool which was a shame, on the other hand, some poolside rooms seemed to have a bit of partying going on so maybe it was best that we were a bit removed. The large pool was heated and towels are available from front desk. We used the free printer service to print our boarding passes and discounts coupons to SeaWorld. Very good wireless connection in the room. A lot of digging was going on in the hotel grounds. This didn't bother us, the hotel has enough old time charm and we were really mostly there at the night, not spending our days at the hotel. Very good beds.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel depending on which wing...”
Reviews.Author: Corpsie74
Reviews.Content: I was hovering over the 2 star rating until I remembered last year when I stayed at the Lafayette around the same time of year (April). In 2011 several friends and I stayed at the Lafayette based on recommendations from the promoter of a swap meet we attended. I booked a room beside the pool and we had a great time. It was warm, the sun was shining, and the beer flowed like water from a faucet. Security kept a close presence and we did have some complaints called on us but that was expected and we complied easily enough (no one wanted to be kicked out). The room/ suite that I occupied had a microwave, mini-fridge, 42-inch flat screen television, 2 queen beds, a couch, and a spacious shower. It was clean and comfy. Last year was awesome. This year (April 2012) I visited the Lafayette yet again. It was a good experience the first time around so seeing as how the live show my girlfriend and I were attending was only a mile or so away, we figured why not stay there again. The room was clean and tidy. We had a king size bed and the 42-inch flat screen was there. There were several comfy chairs and plenty of space for the two of us even though the room was half the size of the one I had by the pool.The bathroom had a hair dryer, plenty of towels, and was clean. The shower temperature was never static so one minute the water was lukewarm and the next scalding hot. I was always having to adjust. The bed was INCREDIBLY comfortable with large, soft pillows. I know neither one of us wanted to get up after lying in comfort for only a few minutes. And then suddenly it happened. There was a loud SCREECH and the room vibrated. We thought it was another earthquake (living in California, it's something you get used to) but then the same loud SCREECH and the room vibrated again. I looked out the window and saw that our room was directly over the parking garage beneath the hotel. As people drove in and out, the gates would raise and lower depending if cars were arriving or leaving. That drove me bonkers later that night and into the early morning hours. Also we seemed to be on the side of the hotel where every garbage truck in the city drove as well as hearing homeless people digging through the large garbage bins (placed conveniently beside the parking garage gates) throwing bottles and cans around, cursing at the top of their lungs. What I should have done the first time I heard it was ask for another room but at that time, we were in a rush to get to the venue and forgot about it until later in the early morning. Embarrassingly, the walls were a bit thin as well as my girlfriend and I listened in horror as the couple next door to us were being very loud and uh...intimate. And no, hearing them wasn't the horrifying part. The horrifying part was that we were uh...intimate that night and morning as well so it dawned on us that strangers were listening in on us as well!! Okay, so my second stay at the Lafayette wasn't as good as the first stay. I still give it 4 stars based on the first time around and now know better than to stay in that particular wing of the hotel. I'm not sure what that particular wing is called, but if you find yourself near or over the parking garage, you'll know you're in for a weird night. PS: I should add, price-wise, I paid about $100 for one night. This is for the previous year as well.

Reviews.Title: “Has great potential and charm but all ruined by visits from cockroaches”
Reviews.Author: moretravelpleez
Reviews.Content: This is not my first time at this hotel. I spent a girls weekend here prior to their recent renovation. The hotel has that throwback vibe to the 40s, where you could imaging people wandering out of their poolside rooms to lounge and socialize at the pool. That was my first visit experience. Despite the rundown condition of the hotel, prison-style toilet, and far from fresh breakfast, I considered coming back. Our recent trip (last weekend), I booked my family and my sister's there, due to the great rate on Hotwire. It was a chance booking, but when I realized where I will be staying, I didn't mind at all. Finding out that they also have family style suites with bunk beds was a bonus. My family stayed poolside while I upgraded my sister to a family suite. Since my last trip, the hotel has a fresh coat of paint, decorator service, better bedding, carpeting, more outdoor furniture, flat screen tv, updated lobby, among other nice touches. I was excited to see all the efforts to freshen up the hotel without losing its mid-century charm. I was willing to overlook the condition of the bathroom (still prison style toilet), most power outlets not working, having to walk past a smelly gutter to get to my room, and dragging luggage up stairs. All was fine and dandy until I went out to pick up dinner for both our families on our last night and brought it back to my sister's suite. While we were eating, I saw an enormous cockroach crawled up the wall. The kids shrieked and my brother-in-law had to get up and dispose of it. To my horror, the kids said that it was not the first cockroach that crawled around in their room. My appetite was ruined and I was pretty upset. I didn't see any in my room, but my mind started to wonder if there are worse things crawling on our beds and floors. For all the money that they took to renovate the hotel, investing in exterminator service should be part of the investment. I really wanted to like this hotel and was willing to overlook most things, but I just couldn't overlook sanitary issues. I don't think I could bring myself to stay here again. Really too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Easter weekend Experienced!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alvin A
Reviews.Content: I reserved 2 apartments one with 3 bedroom and 1 with 2 bedroom to do our Easter Tradition. I just live in Anaheim but we always visit San Diego since I was station there before when I was in the Military. Our stay was terrible. I called the front desk to borrow even one pan since there's no pots and pans inside but has full kitchen. Front desk told me She will check with the House keeping but never called me back. I called again the following morning 3 times, again, She said she'll have the Housekeeping take care of it but never heard from her.We waited and waited for nothing. People were too loud early in the morning in front of our apartment lining up for some kind of fair. I had to park my Van on street neighborhood a couple of blocks away. I told the Manager on duty everything but all She said was sorry, and that shell make sure there's a complete set of kitchenware there for the next guest. That Hotel attracted me coz of the full kitchen, so I can cook some Easter food for my parents and 3 children, but instead we have to bring everything back home.Sooooo dis appointed....

Reviews.Title: “not bad for the price but whould not go out of the way”
Reviews.Author: diananimagoo
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, Historic, property with so much potential. Unfortunaltly even with the new face lift it has just finished it is more like staying a a travelodge. the rooms and bathrooms are average the price was good. but the walls are way to thin there are no elevators. The bar they say they have on site was never opened that I saw. there were no towels for the swimming pool. There free little breakfast that they give you had rotting fruit. this was all the bad stuff I can remember. Know the good stuff Beautiful pool, with patio's door that either lead out to it or balcony's that was nice oh a a reasonable price for San Diego. Thats about it.

Reviews.Title: “3 star hotel that gets 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: StarAlly
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed Thursday through Sunday and truly enjoyed our visit. The pool is excellent (especially for a morning swim). The linen, bed and towels were decent. We opted for the balcony and it was nice to sit out in the evenings to enjoy the music playing on the pool deck and people watch. The definite downfall is the internet - I was never able to connect. Given the size of San Diego, it's easy to be close to everything. For my friends and me, Lafayette was absolutely ideal. Our drive to restaurants and bars was never more than few minutes and often chose to walk. This is a solid 3 star hotel. Don't expect much more.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Austin, Texas (We're full...so come visit, then leave)
Reviews.Title: “Lafayette...yes or no?”
Reviews.Author: ap3266
Reviews.Content: So we had made a reservation despite the questionable reviews. The website looked good, as did the photos. After arriving in San Diego we drove over to check it out. Getting there was easy, but the neighborhood started looking questionable the further we drove. When we got to the hotel, my wife was not impressed. We walked into the lobby (which was empty) and were a little disappointed. The front desk clerk didn't bother to greet us or show us around. The hotel is neat and has a cool history, but we just got negative vibes. The pool is definitely smaller than what I thought. The Red Fox Steak House is indeed next door, but it looked tired and haggard. The biggest turn off really was the area surrounding the hotel. There were some seedy looking establishments replete with homeless people hanging out at a liquor store nearby. We ended up canceling our reservation and stayed elsewhere. I was rather disappointed because the hotel had a cool history...but that's about all it has going for it. If I had millions of dollars to renovate the hotel, I might have done things a little differently to make it seem more inviting. If you're deciding whether to stay or not; I would definitely say to actually go to the hotel first. It might be fun for the more adventurous, and the rooms might not be that bad...but first impressions go a long way. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Good for families on a budget. Great Pool!”
Reviews.Author: Jacksmack
Reviews.Content: This place has been totally revamped since our stay last year. The remodeling is clean and the hotel is able to present clean, fresh and visually appealing rooms. For the price these rooms are hard to beat. That said, many little conveniences are lacking. Our room lacked a functioning heating unit. Not a great problem for us since it wasn't too cold and a space heater was provided. Only one waste basket. We asked for and received an extra one for the bathroom. Water from the shower was a little stingy and control was difficult. The bathroom was very small. Most serious deficiency for my wife, was the lack of a large mirror to put on makeup. The only mirror was a small one in the small bathroom which is fogged up after your shower. Ok, these are small inconveniences and for the price you do not expect luxury. The rooms are quite presentable and hard to beat for the price. Pool side rooms are larger I understand. WiFi is available but a little problematic each day. I do think think the front desk staff could use a little more training in cordiality, like greeting their guests with a welcome and a smile. After all the front desk is the guest's first impression and this IS the hospitality business. Let's make an effort to be hospitable! The blonde French lady does seem to be an excellent manager who listened cheerfully and took interested note of our complaints. All with reassurance and a smile. A smile goes a mile!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: rsspider55
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the worst me and my family has ever been at. Appliances and outlets not working,swimming pool slimy green,staff and especially management should not be in this type of work.If you want to make sure your experience is a good one i would recomend spending your money and time at another hotel. There breakfast is a joke moldy muffins?

Reviews.Title: “Very Congenial Walk into the Past”
Reviews.Author: Margaret J
Reviews.Content: We were greeted with a marveous taco bar at the comfortable, large lobby area. The lobby, complete with luxurious sofas and a large-screen TV is perfect for group gatherings. Apparently, in the past, it served as a community gathering place for special events. Such a good idea for the present time! The hotel is being updated without loosing the elegant ambience. The rooms are so comfortable and clean, complete with large-screen TVs and, of course, a coffee pot. The pool area, surrounded by palm trees and patios and balconies make a lovely place to spend time on warm days and evenings. The meeting room is excellent for conferences and the food served is delicious. This is a lovely, cozy place to enjoy San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Aleja & Ted's adventures”
Reviews.Author: aleja h
Reviews.Content: Walking into the Lafayette is walking back into time. The nostalgic presence of history is strong. The lobby is a friendly entrance with high ceilings and a historical pleasantness of grandeur. Continue through the lobby, pass the atrium and outdoors onto a patio to view the pool with it's surrounding bungalows. I felt like I should be in the garb of vintage clothing to honor this space. Very fun and a Funtastic place to have a party, a reunion or a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “More like a Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: sandman8888
Reviews.Content: Terrible, don't know how they got 3 stars, the guy who gave it to them must be high on something becoz this is a motel not a hotel and there was construction during our stay which made it worse!

Reviews.Title: “Once a Grand Hotel now a comfortable margin”
Reviews.Author: matt2012ad
Reviews.Content: When you walk into the lobby of the Lafayette you see and feel it was once one of the grand hotels of San Diego. Now it is old and a little run down. However it still has a very comfortable feel to it. The rooms are average but comfortable and although it makes them a bit crowded they have a redfridgerator in each room. Do not expect luxury or modern amenities but a very affordable clean quiet room There is a nice pool in the courtyard, although the pool furniture is run down. This is a hotel which is begging to be remodeled to its former glory. The staff was nice. There is a sports bar just off the grand lobby which is friendly but seems out of place.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Sue R
Reviews.Content: I stayed five nights with a large group of people. The taco bar was great - freshly grilled beef and chicken. Meeting room nice. Rooms newly remodeled and very modern and clean. Slight issue with staff response to a problem. Overall a nice stay. Looking forward to staying here on my next visit to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: roy8684
Reviews.Content: This hotel is actually being renovated but you couldn't tell. It already looks like its been renovated. I stayed here for a few days and was pleasantly surprised, the rooms are modern and clean, its in a great location, the hotel is just beautiful all around. The rooms are massive.

Reviews.Title: “Classic charm”
Reviews.Author: Bellevidrio
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my 40thbirthday because the Bar we had my birthday at is across the street, no drinking and driving for us. We rented 9 rooms and we were all satisfied. Great breakfast in the morning. Old Hollywood greats used to Stay here back in the day, frank Sinatra, Ava Gardner, Bon hope, marylin Monroe. Newly remodeled!!!

Reviews.Title: “VINTAGE PROPERTY IN S.D.”
Reviews.Author: Scottysgirl01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not for everyone. However, if you appreciate the preservation of vintage properties you might enjoy a night or two at the Lafayette. They have worked hard at restoring the property visually and it is still a work in progress. The rooms are clean and the housekeeping staff were very accomodating and helpful. There is a lovely old bar/restaurant on the property called the Red Fox. Lots of characters there, the food is so so, but the weekend bartender is awesome. He's nice looking too! As for the front desk staff....not so much. They were less than welcoming. Both of the front desk agents looked annoyed and bothered in dealing with people who were checking in. It was obvious that they were not thrilled to be working there. The Hollywood vintage photos and memorabilia were interesting and for an added touch each room was named after an old Hollywood celebrity. It was like staying on the Queen Mary on dry land. Never made it to the large pool in the court yard...no jacuzzi or refrigerators in the rooms. The best thing is that is is within 5 minutes of Balboa Park, the Zoo, Museums, etc. Great situation for seeing the local sites.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Checking Out”
Reviews.Author: newgensky
Reviews.Content: Too often I have seen people quick to give bad reviews and not often enough good reviews. Yes, this hotel was built in 1946, so with that comes charm, and the need for updating. And updating is exactly what they are doing. When we first checked in we were given a room by the pool that still had no been updated. Even those are..sufficient. But by no means spectacular. We then had to change rooms because our door lock did not function. But once we were sent to the new room we found it was a renovated unit and definitely changed our attitude. You can tell this hotel has a great opportunity to returning the gem it once was for this neighborhood. I say keep up the renovations and they will be there in no time. So for the money and location, a total jem.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad, And The Ugly.”
Reviews.Author: AJ M
Reviews.Content: I chose The Lafayette because of its' location - only a mile or two from Balboa Park, Hillcrest, and North Park. (I lived in these areas from 1960 to 1985.) This was a nostalgia trip to cruise around on my bicycle and revisit my old "stomping grounds" and wanted a hotel near them from which to launch my outings. The location was perfect for that. The Good - the room and bath were clean and refurbished, and the bed was confortable. (I am an older man and I liked the old style architecture.) Parking - secure, enclosed garage beneath the hotel. I liked that. Price - reasonable. $265 total for the three nights. The Bad - on both Friday and Saturday, there was a lot of noise from "party people" - young people who seemed to use the hotel as a gathering place for parties - very noisy. Also, on Sat. night there was a live band somewhere near my room that blasted away until 11 PM. The Ugly - when I checked in on Friday afternoon, the counter person was uncommunicative - almost surly. She was not voluntarily helpful at all, almost as if she hated her job. Definitely not the demeanor that should be on the counter. Bottom Line - I would stay there again, but not on Friday or Saturday because of the noise.

Reviews.Title: “YUCK.”
Reviews.Author: lauralclr
Reviews.Content: first of all, one postivie reviewer wrote 'there are free waffles!' oh god...that is twisted! a disgusting machine in one of the most pathetic depressed rooms you can imagine with gross waffle stuff oozing out. i do not believe for ONE SECOND..that ANY positive review is real. there is no way. this hotel has the atmosphere of a 99cents or thrift store. i swear when i walked in i was in shock. it was EXACTLY like a halfway house that would be on hollywood and vine in LA. the parking is 'free' becuase it is either on the street or in a nasty underground type area that is full. ie--no parking. the interent was free for me because it did not work. although, this could ahve been temporary. if you are young and used to camping out or hosteling it..then you won't care as long as you have a bed. i requested an 'upgraded' room. the bed did not have that tacky flowered 70's type quilt so that was an upgrade. the bathroom floor had a bunch of black, what looked like pubic hairs to me and the tub as well. if i was hosteling it, fine but i was told, when i called , that this was a beautiful place and that the bad reviews were exaggerated or that those people were not in upgraded rooms. part of this 'hotel' is not inside the hotel but in a separate area. when we drove in that evening..there was a hooker knocking on one of the room doors. she knocked for a long while and i called out to her, 'maybe you have the wrong room number!' so she went to check her book. As we went past her...there were some decrepit beachy plastic chairs with some men sitting on them staring into space. It was exactly like being on hollywood blvd in the bad areas. They call the building 'hollywood style' but it is the same as i said, as those halfway houses or other places on hollywood blvd..that you would never go near. yes..maybe the main architecture is there..a giant pillar ot two...wider staircase...but thats about it. my room was wthe 'gary cooper room'! wow...unbelievable. ------------- my husband is the kind of guy who occasionaly eats at mcdonalds or gets a doughnut at ampm . I went with him to the 'breakfast' room. he then said he wasn't going to stay but would leave for work. 'why don't you eat here?" i asked. he said, the food looked sick and he'd pick up a doughnut somewhere. wow! when he said that...it was my triple confirmation that it was not jsut ME who thought the 'breakfast' was horrendous. its basically a basement storage type room, that has the infamous plasticy 'waffle maker' , a vat of waffle 'dough'...dperessing bagels sitting in a plastic case, a bowl of waxy apples. i took one thinking..well if wash it..but the wax was so thick. it jsut grossed me out. when we arrived, and there was no parking, the guys tried there best to find one. (in vain) i felt sorry that they had to deal with things that were not their fault. they really tried though. you could tell they cared. one of the workers helped me bring a suitcase down from my room..so these guys were jsut doing their job.. so, there you have it, unlike the comfort suite inn i had stayed in that had a nice room but horrendous staff, this one had a horrendous hotel with one or two hard-working guys. basically , even if a hotel room had hairs or whatver and the palce was decent,,well things happen...but this place is decrepit....just falling apart,...literally,. hyou could tell they tried to cldean up the sofa in the waiting room...it was a thrift store type couch...but so gross even with the intended clean up...and the table was 70's brown completely chipped formica. as i said these things in and of themselves dlon't make the hotel bad or good..but jsut trying to paint you a picture that if you are looking for a decent 2 and a half star hotel...this isn't it. this is just plain gross and depressing. oh one more thing! prior to coming i read the reviews and a lot of people said, it was sort of a party place. i was worried about that...but when i called they assured me that it only meant that once in a while you could hear some sound...that the walls were not 100% sound proof but in general you could only maybe hear a sound from the cars or whatever. i could hear the suitcases and the conversation up and down the hall so this wasn't true. oh god! forgot this! my rrom had NO VENTILATION! The windows were patsed shut and the bathroom door facing the bed had a big giant square with slats in it. so basically No sound privacy at all when you use the bathroom..since there was no air outlet..they had that giant square in the door so the steam and smells from the bathroom could have a place to go. which is right into your room. that was one of the worst parts of the experience. i've never seen anything like that before.

Reviews.Title: “Find a Motel 6, pay 3 times their rate, and it is still a better experience!”
Reviews.Author: yellow56
Reviews.Content: without a doubt the worst hotel experience in decades, musky room smell, staff looking and acting as if they worked in auto parts house, quoted one rate then charged another, told there would be breakfast, then told there wasnt. Pictures show the gorgeous front shot, then you drive around back to buildings that would be rejected by every major franchiser. what a waste of what was a gorgeous property. i have looked forward to staying at this place for some time. whoa!

Reviews.Title: “get the kennedy suite!!!”
Reviews.Author: evilwook1
Reviews.Content: the room was amazing!the pool was supurb! the staff was very friendly !!!and to top it all off the spa in our room was awesome !!! dont belive all the bad reviews. the rooms are affordable and free waffles!!!!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: nicoledenise
Reviews.Content: Yeah this hotel is in the process of renovating but it is still not worth the stay. My boyfriend and I stayed here 1 night when we extended our vacation and the hotel we originally booked for was completely booked and it was one of the worst nights in a hotel we've spent. THE HOTEL: The hotel is located on a main street with parking around and underground. The parking seems kind of sketchy and i was really skeptical about leaving my car during our stay, but we found a parking spot right outside of our room so that made me feel a little better. The inside of the lobby is nice, but as soon as you walk out to the patio/pool area it is not all that great and i'm hoping they are planning on renovating that as well. When we booked our room we booked a king bedroom, when we checked-in they didn't tell us that the king bedroom wasn't available and that they had changed our room. The pool area is okay, looks kind of dirty though. THE ROOM: We got a non-renovated room and it was horrible!!!!!!!! Like I said, they had switched our room because the one we booked had a broken toilet so they checked us into a two bedroom suite with what i believe was two FULL beds. I sleep on a queen bed every night at home and the beds in this room were definitely NOT queen. The beds were really uncomfortable and the room was just disgusting. I felt dirty just sitting on the bed. The pictures I saw on another travel website didn't show any pictures of the rooms and the pictures on the website only showed pictures of the renovated rooms. so misleading and I had no idea what we were booking. The carpet was dirty, the paint on the walls were chipping, and the door looked like it was too small for the door frame. FREE BREAKFAST: Breakfast was bad, their breakfast room is in a conference type room with tables and chairs. The lights are low and the only things you have to choose from are bagels and DIY waffles. Won't be staying here again...literally half-a**ing this revew. Maybe this hotel will be better when all the rooms are renovated?

Reviews.Title: “Not that impressive but okay for price.”
Reviews.Author: LisaOCgal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as their write up on their website makes them sound better than they are. They did have music at their pool. VERY mixed crowd. Kids were around with little supervision. Worst of all upon check in I was advised that there was no water or no hot water in some rooms for several hours. I spoke with a receptionist girl over the phone to check in early and she was not very nice. I will not stay here again. However, if all you care about is price, stay here. Their complimentary continental breakfast is worth missing. I never skip breakfast; but here I did skip! They write it as a "buffet" it was very divey.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: mla11408
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for the night and The Lafayette hotel is a great hotel for someone on a budget. they just finished renovating their rooms and a lot of the hotel and they look pretty good. There is nothing better than a place with a history and some personality and this place has a lot of it. ever room has a name of a celebrity from the past. ex, our room was Gary Cooper. The room was big enough and very clean. Had no oder, the bed was HUGE and comfortable. new carpet, flat screen tv that works very well. New light fixtures, movement sensor lights in the room and bathroom. and has a very good air conditioner. The ONLY issue we had was the air conditioner started to leak really bad but that was just our room. The bathroom was nice. it has a working and clean toilet. has a nice shower thats big enough and a free standing old style sink. The service was very good, everyone was more than nice to us. we called for towels and they were very nice, when we had the leak, we called and they sent someone up right away, offered us to switch rooms and everything. They also helped us with finding interesting places to go around the city. Location: The location in the city is great because you are really close to absolutely anywhere you wanna be in san deigo. (we recommend old town, its great) its 3miles from old town, 4 from gaslamp, its really convenient. The surrounding of the hotel is not bad really. its actually got some cute little places. and its not scary or loud or anything like that. The breakfast is not bad. they had coffee, hot tea, cold water, and orange juice. they had bagels with cream cheese, butter, jelly. They also had some cereal and milk. and also waffles which were very good. best part were the waffles. We didnt use the pool or the gym but both looked really nice. The FREE PARKING is actually great. its underground parking with key entry. so very safe and close by. and of course free. If youre expecting luxury, this is probably not your hotel but if youre just looking for a few good night stays, this is the place. we will come back if we come back to san deigo.

Reviews.Title: “I liked the nostalgia of the hotel and would go there again”
Reviews.Author: JenMcDaniels
Reviews.Content: This hotel was under renovation at the time we went, as it was built in the 1940's. It has an old, stately look and feel to it,,,with the columns, open lobby and class doors that lead out to the pool. Just standing there, you could imagine yourself back in time; going to that era in history, where life was simpler and the good times thereof. The jazz music playing in the morning in the breakfast room, really reminded me of that time and place and added to the ambience of the whole experience. The rooms are simple yet nice and has all the amenities necessary. Breakfast was nice and there was variety. Located on El Cajon Blvd ("The Bully" by the locals), there is a neon sign to greet you, again, taking you back to an era gone by. It was nice, I felt safe and many places to choose from to eat, etc. Nice hot tub and pool setting. The reception desk could be better at service, as when I asked for information and directions, I was pointed to a filing system of folders wtih the information.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: SlpnBty330
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel because the price was reasonable ($89) and the picture made everything look amazing. Who wouldn't want to stay in a hotel that looked like it was taken from a plantation in the South and transplanted in San Diego? That was far from what it was! The hotel is right on a main road in the middle of "the ghetto". They were under construction so the entire front was covered in scaffolding. The room was musty smelling. The beds were horrible. Like sleeping on a box spring. There were burn holes in the bed spread (and we were in a non-smoking room). The pillows were old and lumpy. The bathroom was the worst part. Toilets that hardly flushed and the faucet leaked when you tried. I expected much more for almost $100.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: 2011serfdude
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing stay. The manager here is a jerk, so their whole customer service stinks. Plus the hotel is junk. Rusted metal fencing around pool, blown light bulbs in our room, and beds so old they sagged almost to the floor in some places. You would have to pay me before I stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A great hoistoric property in San Deigo”
Reviews.Author: AMaxwellToronto
Reviews.Content: Loved the look of your property - what a great pool. I loved taking my laptop out there and working in such a beautiful surrounding. The room was great, and the staff were very attentive. Great central location.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting”
Reviews.Author: joey1234061
Reviews.Content: staff during day was fine night staff (crystal) Rude, unprofessional,nasty and abusive Its her way or the highway. Customer service not used what so ever!

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 602broadway
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. They are in the process of renovating it, but they have price it to reflect this. We were checked into a newly renovated room which was fantastic. I think we were one of the first guests to stay in it. They have put wallpaper on one wall which is so cool, as it makes the room cozy. The pool is fantastic. It is huge with a big sun deck around it with lots of chairs. When I asked about the pool, the staff told me it was designed by the original Tarzan, Johnny Weizmuller. It was so nice that the staff were well informed about the unique history of the hotel. We cannot wait until the whole renovation is done, so we can see what other creative ideas they have come up with.

Reviews.Title: “Pictures are Deceptive! Poor Service, Bad Rooms”
Reviews.Author: cmdevenney
Reviews.Content: The room was not what I expected, old building, poor pluming, and was not ready when we came in beds were dirty and unmade, dirty towels left on the bathroom floor. We asked the front desk for assistance in getting a cab, they gave us 5 numbers that did not work and then refused to call for us, just giving us more numbers to try. Then we we came back to the room at 2 am none of our keys would work and it took over 45 min for the staff to get us back in our room. They were unapologetic. Overall this was a dirty old place, only the lobby seems as nice as the pics show, and the staff seems unorganized and unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Haunted / Roach ridden Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: cubxxlookin4u
Reviews.Content: I was given the Suite with balcony which I later found out was above the Red Fox Restaurant. The room had a nice deck but faced nothing but old homes all around. During the evening I started to notice Roaches dropping from the ceiling and onto the bed and all over.. Nothing was done about it!! At 2 am I heard a loud party going on .. and I called the complain and was told no one was in the wing I was in but me... However later found out their had been a fire in that hotel years ago .. and the spirits roam the hallways ...It is truly Haunted .. I left for the Hilton the next day!

Reviews.Title: “nice old hotel with touches of former elgance”
Reviews.Author: ikusuki
Reviews.Content: Good price for older hotel in need of renovation in general. Some rooms were already renovated. I liked the feel of old time glory days and all the neat photos of stars who stayed there years ago. The bar and restaurant served good food and also dispensed some former elegance.

Reviews.Title: “Pictures are misleading...”
Reviews.Author: BridgesFamilyFun
Reviews.Content: We wanted a nice upscale, non-chain, hotel for our stay in San Diego. I scoured through hundreds of hotels, reviews, etc and ultimately narrowed the choices down to 3. My kids got to pick for us. They chose the Lafeyette. Upon arrival, we found that it is not in a quaint part of downtown but a very commercial area. The hotel is under renovation, but honestly, more than renovation is needed. Upon check in, we went to our room only to find inadequate parking and a room that was worse than what my husband and I located for parties in high school (remember those days?). We requested a different room and did not get much improvement. The electrical was questionable, iron burns on the carpet, paint peeling, door drafts, completely disgusting bathroom fixtures (as in didn't look clean or taken care of), the pool was orange from mold in it, and the entire property looked pretty much in need of a complete tear down. We would NOT recommend this property to anyone- especially since the rate was $140!!! Ridiculous!! Not even worth looking at.

Reviews.Title: “TIRED OF HOTELS WITH FAKE OR MISLEADING PICUTRES AND DESCRIPTIONS”
Reviews.Author: king4evryday
Reviews.Content: not a mad customer or the hotel manager, just a couple that stayed here a few days ago. it is a very old hotel that is really a motel. not well taken care of, we saw no remodeled areas. needed everything from plastering the holes, to paint to carpet to just good old cleaning, unfriendly staff. really the only nice thing was the pool. why must they deceive us...??

Reviews.Title: “Not good. Not terrible, but not good.”
Reviews.Author: ptirvine
Reviews.Content: I must first say, that I was traveling with the family and we have children under 11. Our room had 2 queens with FIRM mattresses. Small, and basic. Thin windows and walls. We could hear all the conversations and hoopla going on outside our window. Inside, we can hear when each of our neighbors arrive and when they are taking a shower. The site claimed that they had free high speed internet, but when I called the desk, they said the rooms did not have it. I confirmed with my wife and called the desk again, then they said "our room" was being "renovated" therefore, did not "yet" have it. hmmmm.... I don't know about you, but internet is often even more important than a TV. So when pressed, they offered to move us to another room, in another building that had internet. It was late, and we were just there for 1 night, kids were in bed, so we decided to just "rough it." I would not be bad it this was not advertised as such. TV was nice and modern. Breakfast.......2 small cereal dispensers, 3 small trays of muffins, orange juice, coffee, and water. Tables and chairs were mismatched. Pictures makes the place look great. Don't be fooled. It is old, and fresh paint will not hide that. At $60/night, I though I was getting a steal. It was worth $60/night. But you have to set your expectations based on the price not based on their website advertising.

Reviews.Title: “Don't make the mistake of staying here!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: daisydvm
Reviews.Content: This was by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The only thing good about the hotel was the price. I guess the saying that you get what you pay for holds very true for this property. The disaster started as soon as we got to our room. We were given one of the "renovated" rooms, which was actually a pretty huge room with two queen beds, a chest of drawers and a TV. That was all the furniture we got. The rest of the room was obviously empty. No ice chests, no coffee, no coffee maker, no fridge, no chair or couch. Absolutely nothing. The room was horribly hot and we turned the A/C on. We very quickly discovered the air conditioner wasn't working. It took calling the front desk three times and their solution was to send a fan over. Thanks to one of the service guys who insisted that the room was too hot, we were moved to a new room. The new room was also a disaster. The air conditioner worked but the furniture was old and smelly. We were woken at 1 in the morning by another guest who had also been assigned our room by the front desk staff. Then we were worken again at 2 and 4 in the morning by drunk guests returning to their rooms. Breakfast was awful. Cereal and a muffin. The breakfast area smelled like urine and there was mold growing in the courtyard. They claim their pool is heated.....NOT SO. The fitness room had only ONE equipment, an elliptical. Their high speed internet was broken and wasn't scheduled to be repaired for 48 hours. The whole thing was a disaster. We were scheduled to stay for 5 nights and we had to change hotels after one night. HORRIBLE. Not worth the money you save and there are a lot of inexpensive hotels in San Diego with better quality and service.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: gglenng
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in Jan. 2011 and were upgraded to a 2 bedroom townhouse condo. The upkeep on this property has been neglected. The tile was peeling in the kitchen, the carpet is very old. But the sink and toilet worked fine. Since we booked at an "unpublished" rate, we got a very good value. We did not have any problems with bugs or roaches as others have indicated. The free breakfast was just muffins, juice, and cheerios, but it was free after all. Parking is very tricky, and there isn't enough of it for such a large property. But give it a try - it wasn't that bad. I would call it a 1.5 or maybe 2 Star, but not 2.5 as advertised.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations of hotel not fulfilled.”
Reviews.Author: AZMN2010
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel online and were quite impressed with the photos of it. Although there were some things we liked about it, there were more things we did not. We did like the spacious quiet room but were disappointed in the cleanliness of the bathroom and dirty carpet in the bedroom. The dry rot around the window facing the pool showed evidence of termite infestation.

Reviews.Title: “What's up with the 'breakfasts'?”
Reviews.Author: Andorin
Reviews.Content: Okay, so the rooms arn't bad. Although they have no kettle, nor desks. Maybe I'm just bitter that all my colleagues were staying at the Hilton. But you can't get away from the fact that the Lafayette is really quite out the way, and that it is has clearly "seen better days". The real shocker with this place though, is the breakfasts. Or even, the lack of breakfasts. You have a choice of two cereals, with the nutritional value of eating sawdust, or a muffin. Add to that some cheap orange juice, and a cup of instant coffee. I've had better breakfasts in a youth hostel.

Reviews.Title: “not much of a 5 stars!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jessika866
Reviews.Content: Ok so we decide for my birthday to go to Gran bahia Principe La Romana. We`ve been in those resort before there are fantastic !! Not so much this time Not only there we`re nothing to do on the resort (little games only with the animation team) and believe me been there at the same time as Hurricane Tomas not too smart and pretty boring but we could`nt even go to sleep in the room the room was infested with cockroaches. Everynight we would find one or two. Not so much for sleeping and relaxing. So here I am back home and I found f"$%k cockroaches eggs all over my suitcase. Believe me when I am done with this companie they will give me a free all inclusive real 5 starts vacation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but far from charming or memorable.”
Reviews.Author: bebe05
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel because it was a about 2 miles away from the zoo and the price wasnt bad. The room overall was okay, but the lobby and hallways could use some febreeze. The carpeting in the room was also far from perfect. The "continental breakfast" was nothing more than muffins and cereal with watered down orange juice to drink so I would suggest skipping it. Dont go walking around anywhere after dark in this area either, unless you want to get harassing stares from strangers. Its a pretty shady neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Right Price, Great Location, Nice Pool”
Reviews.Author: gbunny78
Reviews.Content: The Lafayette is located centrally making it easy to explore some of San Diego's coolest hipster neighborhoods. The rooms are clean in this older hotel. The pool is surprisingly large with tons of lounge chairs and beverages served poolside. A better hotel for child-less travelers as there was some late night partying next to our room that would not be ideal for kids. Breakfast is served but I would suggest skipping it and heading to a local coffee ship instead.

Reviews.Title: “NOT AS BAD AS OTHERS SAY/BUT FAR FROM GREAT”
Reviews.Author: postalsteve
Reviews.Content: Free underground parking tight but enough spots,fridge&microwave,flat panel tv,free breakfast with waffles,outside pool looked nice but was too cool outdoors to swim,internet worked great in room,neighborhood was nice-I went running one morning and again the next evening did not see anything bad at all in fact it seems like a nice family area, air worked well,clean,no bugs or odors as reported by others,local restaurants very close,steakhouse next door was very good,close to zoo/seaworld/petco park,very quiet,free usa paper. That was the good. Hotel is old,rooms small & drab,no clock in room,towels a rarity. traveling as a family of 4 my wife went to main desk asked for towels they said someone would bring some to room,she later checked by pool no towels called front desk was told they be up soon,my son and I came back from a run, showered and had to use t-shirts in place of towels, went out for supper 2 towels finally arrived 6 hours after asking for them,2 towels for 4 people. we heard other guests at checkout also complaining about towels. business room is 1 computer,fitness center did not have a treadmill,gameroom way outdated 2 out of 5 games did not work,no laundry machines.I left the do not disturb sign out on first day there, maid did not come in but maintenance came in anyway to install flat panel tv.

Reviews.Title: “THE worst ever!”
Reviews.Author: jo2222sh
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to begin. Like another reviewer stated, I wanted to like this historical hotel. However, when we drove up I wanted to cry. I can't name just one thing wrong with it, because there are so many!! I've heard it is under construction to update, but it is still horrible (plus, the only signs of work being done are some orange cones in the lobby, a couple of flyers regarding the work, and a plastic runner going up a stairway....on very very old carpet). The hall leading to our room went passed two offices where you couldn't help but look through the windows into rooms with messy desks. Next, when we opened the door to our room I was in shock! Depressing green walls, smelled bad, the bed was as hard as a rock (harder than the beds I've slept on in China, where they like their beds hard). I couldn't even sleep on it and spent two days with a sore back just from laying on it. Looking out the window from our room we were sickened to see an open concrete area with nothing but windows looking out on it. The only other things to see were a ladder and a maid/room service cart. The windows looked like they hadn't been cleaned in 50 years, with cracked glass and a totally messed up lock. There was hair on the bathroom wall, no counter space...only a small poorly place glass shelf directly above the sink (watch out when you wash your face or you'll hit your head!). After the shock of the room settled in we decided to check out the pool area. It looked NOTHING like the website, which boasted a beautiful setting. The first thing to see was the sign on the gate going in stating that people that are not staying there must pay $5. Does that mean anyone can come and use the pool? In short, the pool was as gross as the rest of the place. I wouldn't set foot in the pool and was totally overwhelmed with how depressing and filty everything looked. I've seen low income housing that looked better! After the first night we couldn't take anymore and checked out. At first one desk clerk told my husband that we would have to be out by 11:00. He told her we needed time to find another place and couldn't be out by noon. That appeared ok. However, when we went to check out another clerk indicated that it didn't matter when we were checking out. Hmm? I prefer hotels that are truthful upfront. Overall, even if they are fixing things up, there appears to be no pride in the condition of the entire hotel. They should be ashamed! At least they should take their pictures off the website, since they are nothing like what it really looks like. I will be adding photos so you can see for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!!! Renovations are not complete! Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: sivad9
Reviews.Content: We planned on staying at the Lafayette Hotel for two nights in July. Their website had said that the hotel had just undergone remodeling, so we thought that staying at this historic(?) hotel would be a safe bet. When we arrived at the hotel (in a very seedy neighborhood) we found the remodeling not finished at all. Parts of the lobby floor were missing, and there was none old-time resort feel that the pictures on the hotels website portrayed. We instantly decided to cancel our reservation. The front desk tried to gloss over the fact the renovations were obviously not finished, and seemed to care very little about it. We left, and never will we come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Never ever stay here!”
Reviews.Author: chloeoio
Reviews.Content: Cockroaches everywhere and found them in our suitcase when we got home! Please dont stay here if it is the last place available in San diego! Room was unkept and full of roaches! I woke up to a roach crawling over my face in the middle of the night! The service was awful and the decor that managed to not have any roaches was unkept, and very dated.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: frugs33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in May. I was worried after reading the reviews on here, but it was not that bad. We had a suite overlooking the pool. The furnishings in the room were tired, but it was clean. We had a microwave and fridge which came in handy. The waffles made the breakfast more filling than the usual hotel continental breakfast. I did not find the neighbourhood to be unsafe. The restaurant is open late which is convenient because most San Diego restaurants close by 10. The atmosphere in the restaurant may not be for everyone, but we had a good laugh there. It was too cold when we were there to try out the pool. The hotel is close to Balboa Park and only about 10 min from downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Renovating?”
Reviews.Author: Bizzymom42
Reviews.Content: I agree 100% with Rlphoenix's review. Renovating? Looks like they are just painting over all the flaws. In my bathroom there was major termite damage and newly painted window frames. Wouldn't it be best to replace the rotten wood? The parking wasn't accomodating, not enough room near the room, so I had to squeeze my excursion into a very low beamed parking structure far from my room. I wasn't crazy about the location after all. Didn't feel really safestaying there with my daughter. Definitely wouldn't recommend it. The only positive I have to say is that the room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “A study in contradictions... a poor value”
Reviews.Author: RLphoenix
Reviews.Content: We stayed there last weekend to attend a graduation. It's under renovation, but that can only explain so much... The decor is retro-cool, but everything is shabby - paint, carpet, tile, rotting wood. The pool and deck is large, but the water is green with algae. The beds were mediocre and carpets worn, but there was free broadband (didn't try it) and a very quiet, high-tech, AC unit. The continental breakfast was free, but it was very limited. We saw no bugs (as previous reviews suggested) and there were no nasty odors -- the place seemed to be clean. The staff was nice, too. The problem is, my son stayed just a couple miles away at a chain motel with better amenities for $30 less per night. My wife and I like non-chain hotels, but an illustrious past and historical flavor don't really make up for a shabby room with a big price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, caring staff.”
Reviews.Author: travelermk01
Reviews.Content: I took a last minute trip to San Diego to be with my mother who was unexpectedly hospitalized there. We had no friends or family for me to stay with, so I took a chance on the first hotel I found by the hospital - The Layafette Hotel. The staffed worked to get me the lowest rate possible and when I needed to extend my trip they made sure to keep me there even though they were already booked up. The hotel pool, restaurant, and staff are first rate. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “its ok for one night.”
Reviews.Author: jrobba
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as an overnighter coming back from Hawaii. I hate to write a bad review about the hotel, because it wasn't that bad. The rooms do need to be overhauled. You do feel like you're in a old unkept hotel, but there it wasn't dirty or any reason to complain. It just needs to be renovated. The continental breakfast was nice. Most hotels don't do free breakfast anymore, and the Lafayette does, and has a belgian waffle maker, so that was nice. They have a pool, which i didn't use. The parking is secure in a deck under the hotel. The bed was not very comfortable, but again for a 1 night stay, for less than $100 a night, I thought was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, Bad Upkeep”
Reviews.Author: PeonyPenelope
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lafayette for four nights with friends when traveling in San Diego. When checking in, the lobby looks pretty legit. It has nice furniture and you can see the large pool that is right off the lobby. The service at check in was great. They even upgraded us to a poolside room even though it was us who had the check in dates wrong. Our room, however, was not exactly up to par. As a twenty-something, I am not super picky. I work in hospitality and know that it is really hard to keep people happy. That being said, I think the Lafayette has fallen behind on maintance and cleanliness. Our air conditioning was broken and our patio lock was too. There was a dirty towel left in the sink and mold growing up the side of the shower. The TV was nice though and they had cable. There was free wireless internet access though which was a plus. I didn't mind the hotel so much because it was just me and a couple friends traveling for fun. We were broke and the Lafayette was cheap. However, don't stay here if you are expecting luxury. The people who work at the hotel are very nice but the hotel itself is not.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Raid”
Reviews.Author: scbennett
Reviews.Content: Not only were there two huge bugs that were crawling one on the floor the other on the couch i had never been treated with such lack of respect and talked down to in my life. They told me my room would only be $129 but my card was charged almost $300 dollars for a night that was spent with bugs and when i called to complain the management accused me of smoking in the room and said that is why they charged me that amount when i dont even smoke and then continued on to say that they did not need our business.....well with bugs and service like that i promise they need all the guests they can get so do yourself a favor and if you do plan on staying be well prepared with raid and to be treated horribly!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “So dirty and run down!!”
Reviews.Author: ShannonT78
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favor and don't even consider this hotel! We paid for 2 nights and had to forfeit the second night to stay at the marriot! It is terrible service and very dirty with bed bugs!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Hell - Bob Hope must be turning in his grave!!!”
Reviews.Author: jasmine6596
Reviews.Content: First of all I'm usually pretty good in picking great hotels with reasonable prices as well as location. I read most of the reviews here on trip advisor and thought I'd give this hotel a shot since I'm an optomistic person and easy to please. What the hell was I thinking!! I booked a jacuzzi room for a ridiculous price but thought oh, I'll get what I paid for, WRONG! Front screen window was damaged, door locks where chintzy, power strip hanging off the wall, string hanging from closet to turn light on, small tvs with no remote (jeez), peeling paint in restrooms, torn shower curtain, broken shower head, mold in restroom. Now for jacuzzi, broken knobs and drainage, had to use a sock to plug. worst of all we attempted to relax in jacuzzi until rings of black substance came through!! Please do not be a succer like me and stay here. I'd would've been better off renting a motel6 in compton, calif. Left like a bat out of hell early in the morning to the Best Western Lamplighter Inn who graciously gave me a discount, better continental breakfast, clean room and wonderful staff!!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: MC123California
Reviews.Content: Lafayette Hotel and Suites was the absolute worst hotel I have ever stayed at in my entire life. I booked this hotel to be in Hotel circle and close to Sea World. The title when booking the location was "HOTEL CIRCLE". They were not in hotel circle. They were in an area I did not feel comforatable with my 6 year old son. In addition. The hotel lobby and bar was the only thing they could call a hotel. It looks like they took a "hotel" and attached it to a "motel" for the sleeping rooms. The rooms are tiny and dirty. They are so small that when I opened the door to enter the room it smacked into the dresser. The tile has no grout left in the bathroom and I am surprised the sink didn't fall off of the wall the way it was hanging. There was even bums hanging out in the parking garage I know I got a good rate ... I still paid way too much. I can't imagine that place getting a dollar more. It was so bad that I even called around to try and book another hotel so we didn't have to stay in such a dirty place. The rooms at this hotel are terrible!

Reviews.Title: “Lafayette Hotel And Suites, sandiego ca”
Reviews.Author: frequent_driver
Reviews.Content: The hotel was okay but definately not three stars. The staff was co-operative. Very close to the sandiego zoo. Has lots of fast food and a grocery store closeby. Overall was pleasurable.

Reviews.Title: “Fun fun fun !!”
Reviews.Author: UtahYoungin
Reviews.Content: SO me and my friend decided we wanted to take a road trip and we live in utah so we looked around for awhile for hotels and tthe lafayette caught our eyes !! After a 17 hr drive we were tired and ready to nap.. so we got to the hotel and had our room right then ready . At first we were like this is not a hotel for us it looked like it was like fancy and for old people lol but when we got inside wow !! I loved it!! We got to our room it was so nice !! Then whenever we needed help they would help us. The people at the desk were so SWEET!! We stayed there 5 nights there is nothing really wrong with itt!! I LOVE IT!!! ITS even close to the beaches

Reviews.Title: “Rate This One A Zero”
Reviews.Author: tripin007
Reviews.Content: Those old school stars are turning over in their graves if they could see this name sake place. We drove up and a beer bottle on the steps in front, this was a clue of what was to follow. I've been to old historic hotels and/or motels this one falls very short. The lobby furniture was very worn, with fake flowers and it had funny smell. Then we went to our room, the door sticks, it was dark and it smelled funny. The bathroom had a vent, but it wasn't working, paint was peeling around the sink, the tub/shower could have been clean but you couldn't tell, it had black stuff at the bottom. It was hard for me to walk around in the room and the bathroom with no shoes on my feet. We went to the pool area and could not find a clean table, and it didn't look like there was anyone there who's job it was to keep the area clean and in order,the swimming pool was clouded, we just couldn't bring ourselves to get in pool. Needless to say our family vacation was cut short. Heck, if I wanted visit a nasty place like this I could have just visited my daughter's house. They should just change their policy and make this hotel one of those kind of hotel that the locals can rent by the hour to do their business. THAT'S WHAT IT FELT LIKE.

Reviews.Title: “Not enough lipstick on this pig”
Reviews.Author: 900ftjesus
Reviews.Content: Stayed during the last week in July. Was a huge convention time period, so for the money, this was about the best thing available. The hotel itself is very unique, as are some of the locals who patronize it. It seems that the management is banking on its uniqueness and history and failing to do the things necessary to keep the property to a minimum acceptable level with regard to cleanliness, maintenance and simple functionality of the property. The pool was not operating for the first four days and no one seemed concerned. The front desk did lower our rate for the trouble otherwise deflected complaints with a variety of excuses too numerous to mention. And once it was fixed and refilled with water I never saw anyone testing the water or cleaning it. this would not have concerned me except that on Saturday, Sunday and Monday, they have a locals pool party with entrance allowed to the neighborhood for a fee (I hope)and in the hope they will buy drinks from the bar,(they do). If you stay there, be ready for an instant party in the pool from noon to six or eight pm and grab a lounge chair early because they will be gone quick. This is obviously an attempt to increase revenue, which I am sure does occur but for the management to take the last piece of goodwill left from the actual customers paying the high rates for a hotel in San Diego on the weekend is very short sighted and can only eliminate return customers. The main draw of this property was that it was a decent location and is usually 15 to 20% lower than mainstream properties. For myself in the future, this ceases to be any type of deal as I would gladly pay the extra 10 to 20 dollars NOT to have the same experience. ON a HIGH NOTE, the hotel is a very short walk to an amazing Chocolate, Espresso and Wine bar called Eclipse Chocolate on El Monte blvd. (We will return to this establishment)

Reviews.Title: “AH! =[”
Reviews.Author: msmam12
Reviews.Content: as me and my brother and mother drove down the street i wanted to cry haha then we turned in and saw the pool and thought oh maybe its not so bad got to our room and thought OMG this suckkss you can hear the people next to you and the bathroom had tons of long blck curly hair i could barely go to the bathroom there the beds are very uncomfortable and feel dirty haha this place is I guess for the younger crowd who want to stay up and drink all night I will NOT return to this hotel EVER again

Reviews.Title: “I cried!”
Reviews.Author: Dee83143
Reviews.Content: Omg, this hotel was a nightmare! I was scared to walk into my room and when I did I almost fainted! The room was dark, stunk like someone died, bathroom was filthy, tiles were cracked, carpet and couches were stained, and a bed filled with cigarette burns! My fiancé and I went straight to the front desk to leave asap. Then they talked us into looking at three other rooms including the penthouse. All were disgusting. We did just settle for a room by the pool after they changed the sheets and blankets. We left to enjoy our first day at the bea he's and returned that evening to find throw up next to the bed in our room! I couldn't believe it. Keep in mind I'm nearly 6 months pregnant, we packed our bags and I cried with anger at the front desk and left. They said they wouldn't dispute the charges but still we were charged for one night. We ended up at travel lodge at the hotel circle at 12 am. The rest if our trip we stayed at the Hilton on the bay. We weren't risking it again! We returned to get iu money back but they ended up calling the police on my fiancé because he was raising his voice! Ridiculous. Don't stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: mktmind
Reviews.Content: We normally stay in Super 8 or Motel 6 type hotels, so when I saw the Lafayette hotel rated 3 stars for a slightly higher price, I booked it. Even though the staff was friendly and the lobby was beautiful, the rooms were horrible. There were holes in the wall, the bathroom doors didn't shut, the towel rack was missing, and to top things off, the microwave almost caught fire when we popped popcorn.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Lafayette/San Diego”
Reviews.Author: drosalie
Reviews.Content: Was extremely hesitant in booking our vacation at the Lafayette Hotel after reading some of the reviews. It's no Hyatt, that's a given. But our stay was wonderful! We had a pool side suite named the Fred McMurry Suite, all the rooms are named after "Old School" celebrities. The Hotel has so much history and charm. And it's a bargain. The Front Desk was extremely helpful offering Concierge service and very informative. I hadn't been to San Diego in over 20 years, and really needed help, what a beautiful city. The hotels location is ideal for public transportation, two major bus lines are accross the street, taking you to Balboa Park, Gas Lamp District, Hillcrest, and the Ferry to Coronado. Destinations I hightly recommend. The room was clean, beds comfortable, service extremely friendly, Kay, at the front desk became my friend, I pickied her brain daily, she was so helpful, really made our trip so enjoyable. I'm already planning a return trip, and of course we'll be staying at the Lafayette. Would recommend this hotel to all of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “You have got to be kidding!”
Reviews.Author: lawyergirl07
Reviews.Content: I dont even know where to begin! From the main street, the hotel looks lovely, and kind of cool with a taste of the south. Large pillars, brick building, and huge circular driveway. I over shot the driveway and made a right onto the street that parallels the hotel and was shocked. Its a total dive hotel! I had booked through hotwire and was already billed for the place, otherwise I would have bolt. Upon walking into the lobby I was hassled by several men standing outside of what looked like a bar with a pool table in it. When I walked up to the reception desk there was an older gentleman complaining about several things wrong with his room and his displeasure with his having to ask on multiple occasions for things to be resolved. That should have been my cue to leave. It was finally my turn to speak with the solo receptionist, a young lady that was very sweet. I handed her my credit card and ID and informed her of my reluctance of leaving my car in the parking lot. She assured me that the hotel was safe and had 24 hour security. I also asked about the rooms. She informed me that the rooms were "charming." I looked at her twisted and she giggled. I asked to be on the first floor as I have problems with my knee and didnt want to injure myself more. However, as I made my way around the bend searching for my room, I came to the cruel reality that the room was upstairs. When I got the door, I noticed that the paint was peeling off. Not a good sign of things to come! Oh Mah Gawd! I'm in the seventh realm of Hell! The room stunk. I mean S-T-U-N-K as if there was something rotting in it. None of the light switches worked and I was blind walking in, reaching for a light switch. The first spot with a light switch was the bathroom. I gagged when I saw it. Miss matched tiles, black grout...just plain dirty. When I made my way to the living area and was able to turn on the lamp, I was horrified. The bed was hold with a comforter boasting cigarette burns, the television was teeny tiny and there was a sofa with huge stains on it. I was in the room that is pictured on the Lafayette Hotel's website that is pictured overlooking the pool with a cute little table and flower overlooking the pool. There was no table on the balcony as pictured. Just two plastic broken chairs, overlooking a FILTHY pool! I tried to make the best of my stay, but when someone started banging on my door at 2am screaming and yelling, I was done. I packed up and left and found myself the Marriott in Hotel Circle, where they gladly got me situated in a clean and comfy room right away. Hopefully the management will read this and will take the time and money needed to restore their hotel. It could be a great place with some elbow grease and some cash I packed up

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Shock”
Reviews.Author: NextStopAnywhere
Reviews.Content: As we drove up to the hotel we could not believe it was the same place we saw on the hotel website. We checked in and were told to pull around to the back, this is when we discovered it is not a hotel, but a motel. From the outside back we could see paint peeling and crooked windows. We carried our bags upstairs -- there is no elevator -- and walked along a decrepit walkway that had many levels and we had to duck to keep from hitting our heads. We opened the door to the room and our jaws dropped. We were greeted with leopard carpeting! The rooms were huge but not enough dated, stained furniture to fill them. Also, for some reason in our one bed room there were two bathrooms, each equally disgusting with yellow stained tubs and blackened grout between the tiles. The televisions are all of the way across the large rooms from the bed and couch which is a problem because they are only about 14" and don't come with remotes -- the maintenance said it is because people steal them. The bedspread and curtains were some odd plastic-like fabric and looked straight out of the '80's. There was also the weird smell coming from one corner of the room -- not sure what that was. Also, even though the breakfast is free, you don't want to eat it.

Reviews.Title: “Just a joke of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: BobBarnett
Reviews.Content: My fax says it all. And the heated pool wasn't heated. Ventana Hotels Fax [--] E mail [--] Last Sat nite (Apr 25), we stayed at the Lafayette in San Diego. When I made reservations, I asked for a quiet room. I was originally assigned a 1st floor room right on the corner of 2 busy streets. The only other room available was a handicap room, 155, located just off the lobby. They said it would be quiet. When we got back to the hotel there were tons of drunks having a party in the lobby, 30 feet from our room, and right in front of the front desk. At midnight I had it, called the front desk, and they said they'd say something. It just got louder. Screaming continued for another hour, with doors slamming all night. If you want a party hotel, fine. Just state what your mission is. We checked in to have a room to sleep in, and we didn't get it. I want a refund of the $75 fee. The room was a total waste, and I couldn't change hotels at midnight. By the way, the room hasn't been updated in 30 years. Spend some $, or sell to someone who will. Bob Barnett [--] thebobbarnett@verizon.net Calif State Bar #102602

Reviews.Title: “NIGHTMARE!”
Reviews.Author: HGSF
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel reception while the receptionist (Marianna) was arguing with another dissatisfied couple staying there. I checked in to my room while my cab waited outside. The security guard(Howard Abdul Kabir) saw me coming out of my room before i ran back to my cab to an event. I returned to the hotel at 1am and could not get back into my room with my electronic key. I went to the night receptionist(James Thomson) whom abruptly said that i was assigned the wrong room. At the same time i saw Howard(security) walking towards the reception with my back pack in his hand and my clothes hanging off of it! My expensive laptop computer, wireless card, charger and the laptop bag was taken. I called the police, made a complaint,case #08-028522. I left the Lafayette at 3am to find another place to stay.. I returned home to SF immediately to change all my passwords and contacted my clients for security. I got a hold of the hotel Manager Steve Chelew after three messages and emails whom assured me that he would "take care of me." He ended up handing off the case to his insurance company(Fireman's Insurance) which resulted only $1000 coverage. Be warned that the California Innkeepers Statue minimizes the hotel's losses to $1000 and that you have to make sure that the hotel takes extra measure if you have any valuable over $1000 like my laptop and its contents. HORRIBLE; VIOLATING; MOST UNPLEASANT HOTEL EXPERIENCE EVER!

Reviews.Title: “A classic hotel......... in DIRE need of updating.”
Reviews.Author: Hardyman1966
Reviews.Content: As a local resident I've wanted to stay here for some time. It has a great pool area that attracts a great local crowd. The plusses stop there. I requested one of the poolside lanai rooms thinking it would be a step-up from the main building. Wrong. The inside had bad motel written all over it. Both queensized mattresses were the foam variety that curve upward at the edges. There was a thermostat, yet no sign of any heating vents. The carpet was stained, the room smelled musty and a microwave was stacked on a mini-fridge next to a cracked sink that sat outside of the bathroom. Checking in also was a hassle, which I won't get into. Suffice it to say, no apologies for anything. The Red Fox restaurant and lounge is still a classic, but I wouldn't want my parents staying in what should be called a motel anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Had Money Stolen From My Room! Cockroadhes! Dirty!”
Reviews.Author: photofurry
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE! i am a young traveller and have stayed at hostels around the world and NEVER in my travelling experience have i come across such filth! i have low standards as i am used to traveling on a budget so for me to say this place is HORRIBLE means A LOT. i had money stolen out of my room by the cleaning service and when i conronted the front desk they called me LIAR! straight to my face! i wasnt staying in town for long so i didnt have the chance to resolve the issue by bringing the police into it and i just wanted to leave the ridiculous experience behind me. there were cock roaches found in our room several times. our ice bucket was full of trash and smelled of urine. the walls are PAPER THIN! everytime a toilet flushed, even from several rooms away, you could hear a loud BANG! i wouldnt recomend this room to my worst enemy! you wont get what you pay for here, you'll get LESS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Carmen Miranda Room”
Reviews.Author: daughterJudy
Reviews.Content: I have seen some of the reviews, I thought I would add mine. It was a gorgeous, spacious room. No bed bugs, no roaches. The steakhouse was good. Everything we came in contact with was just right, and for the price, it was unbelievable. Ask for the Carmen Miranda room.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach Infestation filthy accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: Cali-Beaches
