Reviews.Content: This hotel was discusting! The sink in our bathroom was cracked badly and looked like it was going to fall off the wall. The carpet was old and filthy, the cracked tiles which had been replaced were a different color, and there were cockroaches in our room. The staff was unfriendly and when we reported teh problem, hotel manager Christelle Tachon stated the hotel didn't consider cockroaches or broken ammenities major issues. She stated that a major concern would have been something wrong with the food. The pictures the hotels shows depict that it looks beautiful from the front and the lobby with the pool. There are a few rooms overlooking the pool which the hotel claims to have rennovated, but the vast majority of the rooms are terrible. Be warned, and if you choose to stay, keep your shoes on the shelf- away from the cockroaches.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Needs Renovating”
Reviews.Author: basket44114411
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through an on-line company that offered discounted rates on hotels. However, I looked this hotel up on the web and went directly to their website. It is VERY deceiving. On their site, the hotel looks very elegant and beautiful with a colonial look. The rack rate for this hotel was listed as $149-$189 per night! So...we thought we were getting a real deal for around $80 per night. When we followed their directions, we came concerned when we started driving into a rather bad part of town, very commerical. the "colonial" hotel sets right on the street with a narrow circle drive in the front. The hotel was built in the 1040's and it looks like it has not been painted or updated in about 20 years. The front desk is very un-appealing - very institutional for lack of a better description. The front desk clerk told me that they were sold out the night before (surprise!!) and we could not check in before the 3pm checkin time. When we arrived around noon, they did however, allow us to use their restrooms to change clothes and then stored our luggage for us. When we came back, I wanted to see the room. He told me that since we were staying with them for a week, he could upgrade me to a 2-room suite! I said that was very nice, but could I see the room? Another gentleman took me to see this suite which ended up being 2 rooms, one with 2 beds in it and one with a worn out couch, curtains falling off the windows and a torn up table and chairs in the middle of the room! He took me to another "suite" and it looked the same. We had paid for the room in advance in total, so I ended up taking the standard room with 2 beds - it was the "best" of the three rooms I looked. The bedspreads were faded, bedskirts wrinkled and dirty and the carpet was soiled. So.....let this be a warning, don't always trust a hotel's website - they are not always correct! I would not recommend this hotel even to someone just staying overnight. It is worth about $30-$40 per night and is not as advertised. I feel confident that in it's heyday, it was a beautiful hotel. They even had a display that showed the hotel in the 40's and pictures of the celebrities that had stayed here - Bob Hope, to name one. But...it needs millions in renovations!

Reviews.Title: “I should have said something”
Reviews.Author: frev
Reviews.Content: OK... I should have said something when checking out, but I wasn't 100% sure and I had checked out quite early. Both arms...BOTH ARMS...bitten by BED BUGS! I am not making this up and otherwise the hotel is OK. I know it's not a fancy hotel...it's a little aged and quite cute...but one cannot excuse the infestation of bed bugs. Stayer beware!

Reviews.Title: “The Locals Took Over!”
Reviews.Author: fergie_ca
Reviews.Content: This is the absolute last time I'm staying in this hotel. For the past four years, I've stayed here many times to visit my daughter and grandson. The place is ran down, quirky, but was always a quiet and affordable stay. Plus, you're willing to overlook small things to be close to family and not pay out the nose. Always before, this was a family-friendly place. I felt comfortable having my grandson over for a visit and to swim in the pool with me before we went out to visit the sites of San Diego. This time, we were faced with the most disturbing trend I've ever seen - every day from 12:30 to 6 p.m., they let anyone come in off the street and use the pool for $5 per person. Imagine taking your grandson to swim in a pool that was packed with people who were NOT PAYING GUESTS... drinking.... cursing every other word... And I was never notified when I checked in that this was going to happen. Then on top of that, we went out and brought sandwiches from a local restaurant to eat by the pool. We were told that we could not eat it by the pool, but we had to go up on the balcony instead. WE WERE PAYING GUESTS and had to move!!!! This was unreal and completely poor customer service. I complained to the manager, who just said this was their policy. She was matter of fact and offered nothing to make me feel like a respected guest.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Pool Area”
Reviews.Author: LuckyJackson
Reviews.Content: It's clear that the management isn't spending a lot of money to upkeep this hotel. The railings in the pool area are rusted through and there are many broken tiles about. These are minor issues compared to the overall beauty of the pool area, especially as viewed from either the patio or hot tub areas just after dusk. From talking to other guests, it was clear that the bathrooms are the worst part of this hotel. Ours was in serious need of being redone, or at least a thorough cleaning. Also, it seems that the rooms that are not surrounding the pool area tend to be larger rooms. Our room was decently sized, and I loved that we could walk out of our room and right into the pool. The surrounding neighborhood is not the best example of the beauty of San Diego, though it is very close to the Zoo and Balboa Park. Other than that, honestly, the hotel was worth the money we spent on it. More than likely we won't stay here again, though we were happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Guest beware”
Reviews.Author: Scruffy42
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms for friends and myself at the Lafayette, and we were very unsatisfied with our stay there. Problems in the rooms included: - no soap brought by housekeeping - several lights that didn't work - the shower dial was put on in reverse (hot water where the cold water was, and vice versa) - no alarm clock in one of the rooms - no hot water one morning - and the air con didn't work properly on the last night. On top of that, the computers in the business centre had a very slow internet connection that sometimes didn't work at all at times. However, the biggest issue came when I attempted to check-out. On my second morning there, I asked at the front desk what time I'd need to check out by, and was told that I could do that whenever I wanted. But several days later, when I attempted to checkout at 4 pm, I was told that checkout time was 12 pm, and was charged another half day's rent for the room. When I attempted to explain I'd been told there was no specific checkout time, they denied that anyone on their staff would say anything like that. I would not recommend this hotel to others, and will certainly be looking for alternative accomodation should I return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “nothing wrong with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rose1208
Reviews.Content: After getting this hotel for $50 per night with breakfast through Hotwire, I was very nervous. I read the reviews and really wanted to change it. My husband and I are used to 4+ star hotels. the reviews on tripadivsor were not complimentary. But I have to set the record straight for this hotel. When we arrived we were given our room and although not a four star it certainly was clean, comfortable and roomy. We had no complaints. The complimentary breakfast was great and we looked forward to it on a daily basis. This hotel had a lot of families and uni students on their summer break, but it was not noisy. Transport to San Diego was easy on the number 15 bus and we used this transport for $5 per day pass without any difficulty. Staff were friendly and helpful, the cleaning staff were just lovely. I would without hesitation recommend this hotel to any person wanting a clean, comfortable hotel at an affordable price. We also found a wonderful Lebonese cafe around the corner (Mama's, I think) the food was delicious, big servings and cheap as chips) I would recommend this to all to try.

Reviews.Title: “Nice break from Hotel Circle”
Reviews.Author: Jimi68
Reviews.Content: We were worried about staying at this hotel after reading the reviews of fellow travelers, but I have to admit that the hotel is not as bad as described in those reviews. Sure there were a few issues, but nothing to ruin our vacation. We knew that this was not a fancy four star hotel, but it was nice to get away from the crowded and noisy Hotel Circle area. I would stay at this hotel again in the future. Positives: cheap price, pool, good bartenders, cool neighborhood with some good family restaurants and fun bars to visit Negatives: front desk, business center (only one out of two computers worked), shower would routinely alternate between scalding hot and freezing cold, maid service was inconsistent, jets did not work in the jacuzzi

Reviews.Title: “Realistic Expectations”
Reviews.Author: holjim
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a room via Hotwire in January because we were going to run the Rock N Roll Marathon this past weekend. After finding out what hotel we would be staying at, I have to say I was very concerned. The Lafayette has not done well on the review side as you will see if you scroll down. That being said, my expectations were pretty low as we pulled up Saturday afternoon. We intentionally came after getting signed in downtown at the Marathon, as we had read about problems relating to the Lafayette and early check-ins. We arrived about 2:30 (check in is at 3:00) and were greeted by a friendly desk clerk who quickly, upon learning we'd like the quietest room possible since we'd need our rest and have to get up very early on Sunday, upgraded us to a presidential suite. Now granted, I can't imagine a president stepping foot in this hotel but...it was clean, twice the size of what we paid for (a discounted room at about $65/night) and as promised, was in the quietest part of the hotel complex. Being a Southern California resident and fairly well acquainted with San Diego, I really think your like or dislike of this place will depend on your level of expectation, as well as doing the reading on sites like this in terms of what to expect. With that in mind, here are a few observations that I would put high on the list of things to note if you are thinking of staying here: 1) As you've probably read, this is an old building that apparently was going to be condo'd a while back and by the looks of the permit request signs on the front windows, is in the midst of being sold or having new management come in. As such, the rooms are not terribly modern. There are cracks in the walls. Fixtures in our bathroom were drooping a bit and it just had the feel of a very worn place. From what I could tell, most of the place sort of falls into that category. 2) With most of the rooms surrounding the pool area, this hotel is catering mostly to young people (or very care-free families). There is piped in music all day around the pool and while I almost have to laugh when typing this, the vibe is sort of a very wannabe Hard Rock Hotel in Vegas. Lots of 20 somethings taking in the sun and drinking/laughing/partying. 3) There has been a lot written about the neighborhood. Again, it is all about what you expect or perceive but frankly, I was very surprised after arriving there because I found it to simply be a middle class, albeit old, neighborhood. I went out both nights and never felt the least bit concerned for my safety. All this being said, would I recommend the place? For the third or fourth time, it would depend on what that person was expecting for their money. If I was flying the family out from Green Bay for a week in sunny Southern California for our big vacation would I want to stay here: absolutely not. For a family vacation I would do the research and find a moderately priced (if money was a big concern) chain hotel around Hotel Circle where I would know exactly what to expect and which was close to all the attractions. If it was a couple I knew who were also coming down to SD for a weekend to see a ball game or run the Rock N Roll Marathon, I would have no problem suggesting it. My expectations may be lower than some. Unless I am specifically looking for a fancy, upscale place, I can deal with an old and outdated place if it is clean and the price is right. This isn't too say that some of the nightmare's you're reading about didn't happen but I cannot say they happened to me. I was far enough away from the circus at the pool that my wife and I both slept well before the marathon (something that, given the high stress level, could be tough at any hotel). I even used our free drink tickets Saturday afternoon and hung out on the patio overlooking the pool for a bit. So...at the end of the day, my suggestion is simple: If any of the things you've read, really worry you (noise, location, old rooms, etc), you should probably just find a Holiday Inn rather than risk being disappointed. If you want a fun place to cut loose at the pool and hang out with your friends on the cheap, you'll probably love it. I am in neither group and for me, the negative hype did not live up what I was expecting (thankfully!!!) and although it's far from the nicest place I've ever been, it is not even in the ballpark with the motel (national chain even) that I stayed at when I ran the marathon here in 2002 (but that is a horrible rant for another time!). Do the research and you'll make the right choice! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: azroadtrip
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the photos and description through the San Diego Zoo's preferred hotel package website. It looked like a beautiful old building, and sounded as though they'd done their best to preserve the original look and feel of the hotel of the stars! Only, their idea of preservation seems to be that they've never actually renovated anything except the facade and pool. The carpets were old. The couch and chair were stained, torn, and greasy. The towels were old and scratchy. The ceilings were cracked and badly patched. The TVs didn't work properly. The water went from scalding to freezing and back multiple times no matter where the knob was set. The bathroom floors were filthy. The a/c units rattled so loudly we couldn't sleep. The whole place smelled like an old folks' home. And the area of town! I didn't feel safe outside after dark, the street noise was extremely loud (as was the noise from the pool partiers), and the cops were called to the premises while we were there. The staff was less than helpful. While they did upgrade us to an executive king suite, they did not provide us with any information about using the phones, the continental breakfast, or the shuttle to the zoo (which we therefore missed). The cleaning staff spent half an hour banging on our door at 8 a.m. because they wanted to clean our room. Granted, we forgot to put out the "do not disturb" sign, but continuing to bang on the door that early in the morning because the deadbolt was thrown was just excessive. There were also signs in the windows giving notice of application for permits due to a change of management. I hope that the new owners turn this place around and make it as nice as it should be, but I definitely won't be back to find out.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Meli75
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel using Hotwire so of course did not initially know where I'd be staying, but it was a great rate so I gave it a chance. I think this hotel was probably one of the hot spots back in the day. It is nice, clean, and the staff were friendly and helpful. The room was small, but was fine for the one night I stayed. The swimming pool is large, but the water was quite cold. It is only about a 5-10 minute drive to downtown San Diego and there is public transportation (bus) that picks up and drops off less than a block from the hotel. Personally, I felt the area was a little sketchy upon arrival, but I never felt unsafe while there. I wouldn't necessarily choose to stay there again, but if it were an option for a reasonable price, I would.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Bobkatevan
Reviews.Content: We booked same day through Orbitz. Checked in fine. Had to wait about 10 minutes, since Orbitz hadn't faxed in our reservation. Not a big deal. Yes, the hotel is old and needs to be remodeled, but we only paid $89 for one night and I thought this was a great deal to include breakfast. We checked in around 3 pm and spent one night. We were in room 328 and overlooked the road. The bed and room were clean. Large room. Shower initially was cold and was told the water heater broken earlier. Morning shower was nice and warm. Breakfast was fine, waffles, fruit, bagels, cereal, coffee, teas and juices. Check out was speedy. Parking was free and was easily accessible. I would stay here again for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: AB_Travel
Reviews.Content: I booked three nights at the Lafayette for my son and his girl friend - Jan 31-Feb 3. They are a frugal couple and not overly fussy. We read the reviews and checked out the location. The price and the location won out over the bad reviews. We thought people were too picky. Sorry. Should have listened to the bad reviews. My son was not happy. The first room was totally unacceptable - too loud because it was right beside the pool entrance. Second room was something they could stomach but still pretty bad. They just kept repeating, "It's only for 3 nights" The neighbourhood is run down and the hotel needs a major renovation. The walls are paper thin. My son sleeps soundly but the snoring in the next room woke him. Free breakfast is finished at 9:30 AM. Not a place to enjoy or to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent pool”
Reviews.Author: hershanator
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been happier with our room w/ a pool view. The facility was clean and the atmosphere and staff were upbeat. Great food in the bar with a very cool bartender -'Fabian'. I had a wonderful Birthday:)

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: manndorf
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I've ever stayed: (1) Arrived at 2:30pm. Check-in was denied. The front desk staff said check-in is not until 3pm. Though this is the hotel policy, most hotels are more accommodating than La Fayette. They seem to forget that they're in the hotel business. (2) The cleaning folks forgot to replenish shampoo in the bathroom when I first enter the room, so I have to ask for it. (3) The next day, they completely forgot to clean the room! They weren't able to change rooms or lower rate to compensate for the missing service. (4) Breakfast is so-so. Probably the same (or slightly worse) quality as HoJo. Definitely cannot beat Hampton Inn or similar chains. I will not recommend anyone to stay. And will see when La Fayette will finally close down.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, nice little place”
Reviews.Author: john44pacnw
Reviews.Content: We booked with the property directly and because we did we received an upgraded room. While some of the common areas (halls, elevator) could use more cleaning, our room was clean and reasonably quiet. The location worked for us, 2 or 3 minutes drive to the wine bars and restaurants of Hillcrest. We liked it and found the staff very pleasant

Reviews.Title: “More than acceptable for the low rate and location”
Reviews.Author: pandacub
Reviews.Content: I reside in San Diego but chose The Lafayette for a week-end stay, due to its location and low rates. The Lafayette was due for a condo conversion a few years ago but the plans were halted, which accounts for the unfinished state of some renovations and projected improvements. I would hesitate to recommend The Lafayette for a visiting family, since it is a bit aways from most tourist attractions, though only slightly farther than properties in Hotel Circle and downtown, and only two bus lines (11 and 15) stop near the hotel. Also, during my stay there were a couple of private functions (receptions and the like) so people gathered poolside and at the outdoor grill until late hours (Saturday night) which could be problematic for those desiring earlier bedtimes. Still, for any guests unconcerned by mild noise levels, a bit of peeling paint here and there, and willing to walk a half-mile to the fun restaurants and bars of University Heighs and Hillcrest, you can't beat it! The staff were friendly and professional, and I experienced no problems with water or room temperature (my room had a unit which served as both heater and A/C). I for one am glad it's still a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: traveler142
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms on the internet. Neither room had heat and the water was never more than luke warm. The electricity went out in one of the rooms the first night. There was no manager on site to help us resolve the problems.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people, but lots of problems”
Reviews.Author: Kivablue
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to get away for Christmas this year and found a great deal on this hotel through Orbitz. The pictures looked great and when we first arrived at the hotel, it seemed to live up to its image. However, upon first entering the hotel we got a wiff of what smelled like raw sewage. Bad first impression. Check-in went smoothly and we were in our room quickly. We had a king suite which over looked the pool area, which is the best feature of the hotel, so again we were pleased and ready to disregard the bad smell of the lobby. The room was a little shabby, but clean. It was also nice having free internet access for my computer guru husband. That night, however, the problems began. First thing we discovered was that the heater in the room didn't work (which wouldn't be a problem any other time of the year, as it IS San Diego, but at Christmas time the weater at night gets down into the 40s and with a single-paned set of French Doors seperating us from the pool area, it got quite cold). I called the front desk and told them my room number (514) and explained that our heater didn't work and was a nice customer and didn't demand that someone come out and fix it like I should have, but instead just asked for extra blankets. It was only later that we learned that they had a list of rooms in which the heaters weren't working and ours wasn't even on the list! Which means that they were aware of the problem else where in the hotel and should have sent someone out when I called, even though I didn't ask them too. But that's just my impression of good customer service. On the second night we were too cold even with all the extra blankets that we learned that they couldn't 1) fix the heater nor 2) move us to another room as they were all booked out . Finally, I asked (they weren't doing a great job problem solving) if they might have a space heater they could lend us. And "oh! what a good idea!" was the response. So much for customer service again. So then in the morning of the third day, we received a notice under our door that at noon that day they were going to have shut off the water to the entire hotel to do plumbing work. After the water was turned back on we heard pipes banging all night long. We should have called that night to report the banging, but didn't want to be known as the "trouble customers" and hoped the noise might disappear on its own by morning. Unfortunately, it didn't. We received a phone call on the fourth morning letting us know that they were going to have to turn off the water AGAIN at noon. I reported the noises we heard and they said that that was why they were turning off the water again. We returned to the hotel that afternoon to discover that the banging hadn't stopped. We went to the front desk to ask for some sort of compensation. We had had to tolerate a freezing cold room, bad customer service, no water, and banging noises all night long. They said they couldn't give us any monetary compensation because we'd pre-paid through Orbitz, but that they could move us to another room. We went to look at the room and, wow!, it must have been the emergency back-up room, because although the heater worked, it was very loud when turned on, the view was of the roof of the floor below, and it was even more shabby then the one we had. So we decided to wait and see if the plumbing issue would clear up (as the front desk reassured us would happen). The front desk told us to call and have someone come over if we did hear anything. The noise did not clear up and when we called to have someone come over we were told that it was a "temporary situation" and that it would definitely clear up that night, but that they couldn't move us to another room because they were booked up again (so what would they have done with the guests who were currently in the room we had looked at that afternoon?). Anyway, all in all, the hotel looks nice from the outside and the staff, although nice, are unhelpful. It seems to me that they should definitely do some maintainance if they want customers to return. Good luck if you choose this one.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel pool ever”
Reviews.Author: jamcquay
Reviews.Content: The rooms are so-so and the walls between rooms are paper thin but the outdoor heated pool makes up for it. (NOTE: The hot tun as of November 3rd, 2007 is under construction). This hotel is not central and requires a bus ride to the downtown (number 15 goes right to broadway so no problems there). The bar in the hotel was actually pretty decent as locals from the area also go there... I would stay here again just for the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rromy
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the half moon driveway, I knew we made the right decision to stay at the Lafayette Hotel Inn and Suites. It was like a southern scene. The hotel staff were great and the ambience of the lobby, lounge and patio areas gave you a very warm feeling. Just beautiful!!! Our room was nice, not great. We had a king room on the 2nd floor and the view out the window left alot to be desired. Roof top only. The bathrooms need a little grout work, but it was okay. We just really liked the whole experince in general. The bartenders are very friendly and make sure you have what you need. The outside patio areas are very inviting and a beautiful scene. The Red Fox Restaurant on the premises takes you back to a different era which was very cool. Good food and warm ambience, decent prices. We really had a good time staying here; it was close proximity to everything we wanted to see and do in the San Diego area. The El Cajon Boulevard area the hotel is on is very nostalgic looking. Nothing to be afraid of. You will not be dissappointed staying at The Lafayette Hotel. Try to get a poolside with patio room. We will next time for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up - we had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: gmossfish
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lafayette for three nights about two weeks ago and I was frightened about what I had read. I almost changed my hotel reservations, but I am glad I didn't. It is NOT terrible. We found it to be charming and a great deal! The pool was never crowded and the pool bottom is NOT mold, it is a pebble like bottom. Very nice pool. Breakfast was great. Plenty of choices and eating on the patio was lovely. Our room was small, but we didn't spend a whole lot of time in it. After all, we were on vacation and it was perfect for us (mom, dad, and two small children.) The hotel was quiet, even during the middle of the day for nap time. Location was good. We couldn't afford the beach, but this was close to everything. We never felt unsafe and the car was in a secured underground lot. I expected to come back and chew them up like everyone else, but instead I feel like they have been wrongly accused. We enjoyed everything about our stay and we would stay there again. I am really baffled how my stay could have gone so differently from so many others. I have stayed at the Ritz and this is not that, but it was charming, comfortable, nice, and we really enjoyed it. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Gross Gross Gross.... Better to Stay at Home”
Reviews.Author: APPARELCFO
Reviews.Content: My first impression came from the two drunks passed out on the front steps, my next sight was the obese prositute hanging out in the lobby asking all passerby if they wanted some "company". The front desk clerk was a gum-chewing hard-bitten lesbian youth with no time for guests who wanted to check into their prepaid rooms. She had more important things to do, like talking on the telephone and holding hands with her biker chick gurrrlfriend. The first room I was given had an enormous blinking red neon sign outside the bedroom window. Even with the curtains shut I felt I had been transported from San Diego to Abu Ghraib for interrogation. The second room condition was horrific. Stained carpets, moldy mildewy smell, and peeling paint on both the exterior and interior walls, also since when should the color of the pool water be GREEN. The neighborhood surrounding this hotel is ghetto...there are police cars on constant patrol, not for your safety, but to arrest the miscreants who rape and pillage the surrounding streets. This hotel currently rates as the worst stay of my life, beating out the night I spent on the floor of Heathrow and the time I was stranded at the Israeli border and slept in my car for a week.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: traveling_galArizona
Reviews.Content: I booked 10 rooms for a family reunion, based on a stay at the property several years ago. I checked the hotel's website and spoke at length with the reservation agent. I was assured that the rooms had been updated and remodeled. Upon arrival I was very disappointed to see the worn and shoddy condition of the rooms. Carpet was bare and the upholstery on the furniture was threadbare. The bathrooms were in need of repair. The tile was loose and the general appearance of the room and bathroom was old and worn. The airconditioning was noisy abnd ineffieient. We also were not told of the policy that the bar has if you come in and by a drink you have pool privileges. So during the day and into the evening the pool area was over crowded and there were no chairs or lounges available for the registered guests. Not to mention the the questionable character of some of those people. Our group was most uncomfortable. On the evening of Labor Day there was a loud group with loud music until 11 PM when we complained to management. It took several complaints to have the music quieted. Needless to say we were very disappointed and will never stay at this property again and would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “its ok for the price, dont expect much”
Reviews.Author: p44
Reviews.Content: Initially we were little bit worried after reading the reviews.But we found it ok to stay.Breakfast is also ok but think need a bit variation.No bath tub,prbably because its a very old Hotel.Swimming pool is nice but not temperature controlled.in short don't expect too much because you have not paid that much.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: miles661ca
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Sand Diego after driving 5 hours from Bakersfield, CA. We left after a work event and made it to the "room" around 2 AM. Exhausted, we crashed immediately. We awoke to a filthy, dated room. There was mold in the bathroom tub area. The overall dissrepair of the bathroom raised concerns for our safety: The shelves and vanity wobbled on the wall; the wall-attached dryer was filthy; the exhaust vent was monted to the wall with dry-wall screws, the tissue dispenser fell out of the wall when I tried to remove a Kleenex; and worst of all the safety bar for the tub hung from the wall by a single screw with gaping holes into the tile and wall behind it. I could go on and on about the Horrible experience we had here but I'll le the pictures speak for themselves...

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice...”
Reviews.Author: CanadaJaybee
Reviews.Content: I tried so hard to love the Lafayette, but I just couldn't. We had booked second-floor poolside rooms for two families from August 19-25. We spent two nights at the Lafayette, then moved to the Westin downtown. The only reason we stayed the second night is because we missed the checkout deadline that day (because we were out looking for a new hotel). The "public" areas of the hotel appear to have been renovated, and the lobby is lovely. However, the renovation seems to have come to a standstill - not sure if they have changed plans, or run out of money, or maybe they have decided to tear it all down. There is no evidence that the renovation will resume, other than some reno plans hanging on the lobby wall. Whatever their plans are for the future, they have totally neglected necessary repairs and maintainance in the present. We had a number of small issues within the room - TV remote stuck on channel 3, lid on coffee pot broken, which meant the "drip stop" couldn't open and the coffee couldn't flow out (which I discovered after the basket overflowed!), tiny dirty bathroom, balcony door wouldn't lock, and so on. If we had decided to stay the whole week, I would have mentioned these things to management, but I just didn't care enough at that point. Another small thing - but a big thing to 5 children - they don't really have the popcorn and soda "happy hour" they claim to have. We asked the bartender about it, and he said they stopped that over a year ago. Another complaint from the children - the pool was filthy and full of hair. I didn't go in, so I have to take their word for it, but I did notice that the pool water was so murky that you couldn't see the lines on the bottom. The most puzzling thing about this place was the balcony floor - it was gravel! I don't know if it was an old surface that was crumbling, or if they actually sprinkled sand and gravel on the deck, but you could not go on the balcony in bare feet. And of course the gravel ended up on the carpet in the room, but again, we didn't care anymore. The area of town isn't any worse than any other area - you can find used condoms and needles on the streets downtown too. The problem we had with the area is that it's not within walking distance of anything. There aren't many restaurants in the area - we had Domino's pizza the first night because we got tired of looking for a place to eat. The second night we ate at In-N-Out Burger because it was near the mall we went to by bus. Denny's was the busiest restaurant in the area, which tells you something. We tried going to the Red Fox in the hotel, but it truly scared us. Sleazy doesn't begin to describe this place. "Smoke-filled honky-tonk" comes to mind. When I first chose this hotel, one of the deciding factors was that it is supposedly a non-smoking property. Not quite - the rooms are non-smoking, so people smoke by the pool, in the outdoor eating area, or on their balconies. We had smokers in the room next to us, so they did their smoking on our shared balcony. We couldn't even have our balcony doors open because of all the cigarette smoke. There were a couple of positive things, but not enough. The room was a good size, and it had queen beds which we found comfortable. This would be a beautiful property if the owners would either finish the renovation or take care of the little repairs. If they aren't willing to do that, a bulldozer is the only answer. Sorry Lafayette Hotel - I tried, but it just didn't work out.

Reviews.Title: “Lafayette Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GolferFolks
Reviews.Content: Old Hotel but refurbished somewhat. The Lobby is very nice but the rooms need some work. Our room was roomy. Bathroom is small with no space for toiletry items. Painting was drab in bathroom. The continental breakfast was average. Parking is free in an underground garage that is only accessble by your room key card so it is secure. Staff was average in service. Location is not in downtown San Diego but a short drive to all tourist places. We ate dinner at the restaurant in the hotel and it was nice. The best part for our party of four was the Chicken Pie Shop that is down the street. For $6.00 we got the best meal deal in town. And it was good!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty!!! You could not pay me to stay here again. Horrible!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tracyandjjtravels
Reviews.Content: Dear Travel friends, We all spend so much money to go somewhere nice. We work hard all year, and really look forward to vacation dont we? PLEASE, do not stay here. The hotel room had bugs, mold, hard beds and was dirty. It has NOT been renovated like the web site says, the place in the 1940s was probably very nice. But it is now a mold infested, dump. PLEASE trust my opinion. I have traveled 50% of the time for the last 22 years and this was the worst ever!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: wizbang11
Reviews.Content: Hi, We checked in and found the room we were promised was not the one we received. the room they gave us had mold on the walls and in the bathroom. The place was run down. In a high crime rate area, which is not obvious untill you get there. The room smelled, the beds were lumpy. And the tenants from the run down apartments all around the hotel use the hotels pool and facilities as an extension of their own apartment. A very ugly place to stay. Then to make things worse, when we told the Front Desk that we needed another room, they didn't have one. So we checked out and they charged my credit card anyway. And as of 3 months later have refused to reverse the charge. So I have had to dispute the charge with my credit card company. A terrible place for a vacation or even a quick stay. Plus this is not a family friendly environment. That is unless you don't mind used condoms and drug needles in the parking lot and in the nearby streets. And I have to mention the neighbors arguing about drugs all night long.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: travel12381
Reviews.Content: Hotel has great potential, but unfortunately remains in need of repair and maintenance. Bathrooms in rooms were with mildew and smell of urine. Stay would have been acceptable if staff members were professional and friendly, but we did not encounter this. We chose to shorten our stay at this hotel and find accomodations elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Oh please, this hotel was super duper! Whats all the fuss?”
Reviews.Author: lolasanfrancisco
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I was expecting a dump run by evil little snots. However, what I did find was a amazing room, overlooking a fab pool and jacuz, with pool side waiter service. The staff was sweet, and even when I spilled a dring all overmyself like a dumb-bo they ran over, cleaned it up, poored me another and didn't charge me. Come on, this is not a 5 star Hyatt, this is a funky local hotel that I am going to stay at everytime I come back, and thats 2x a year.

Reviews.Title: “The Good,the Bad and the Ugly.Not Good ”
Reviews.Author: cracal
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reveiws on this hotel we decided to take a chance for a trip down memory lane given this hotels history, this is where we come to the only good feature. The hotel was obviously grand in its day, the entrance and reception area have some great features "BUT" it's all been renovated on the cheap and once away from this area we come to the real story as mentioned in previous reviews its a dump. We are very seasoned traveller and have stayed in all type of hotels,motels etc all over the world and know what to expect from most places but ths place is just too misleading. We had a newly renovated room with balcony overlooking the pool (sounds good huh? ....well it wasn't!) the room was quite large but had a very odd smell, renovated meaning a lick of paint on a 60 year old door and someone had brushed the carpet. The balcony had a flooring of sharp loose gravel, very dirty old plastic chairs and a palm tree which encrouched into the room! The pool and this is probably unfair but it just looked dirty and so we didn't use it. Breakfast comes free but once again cheap produce and pretty much on a first come basis (don't leave it late). All in all we had pre booked and payed online through expedia (£50 per night) but we found it in a hotel voucher book we picked up in vegas but it wasn't called the Lafayette it just said inns & suites you could tell by the photo and the address and was $89 + tax about the same money so our advice would be look before you buy.

Reviews.Title: “Problems”
Reviews.Author: TifGreen7
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a website for my family, for my Brother-In Law's b-day celebration. We drove into town from AZ expecting a long weekend in a nice hotel. The hotel staff, is not the nicest around. We called once from the road to see if we could check in early. They told us to call back in a couple of hours, we did and they promptly replied no. We had a sick family member with us. We got to the lobby and were told, we can have a room available in 20 min, great, it was better than nothing. 30 min passed and another couple walked in from the street and they were checked in, in no time. More time passed and eventually we were checked into both rooms, they upgraded us both to suites, we were satisfied. The room was old, we expected that. They had new carpet installed and some nice queen sized beds. The ceilings have major water damage and there are some nails sticking out of the ground due to the new flooring installed. The bathrooms were small, but cute. The shower itself was possessed; you either had really, really hot water, or really cold water. The drain didn't work; it would fill up as you showered. Then the next morning we found a roach. Yup on the side of the drapes, there it was a huge one. My mother in law caught it, they offered to have it taken out of the room and were told by maintenance that it was due to the flooring being put in. They offered us to switch rooms, but we figured hey, it's the flooring, it makes sense. We stayed. The next morning, we leave early, come back in the evening, and there is another one in our bedroom again. This time we call the staff downstairs and they state” we’ve never had a complaint about roaches" We state, well we called yesterday about one. They come up to get this one and then say, that it was due to the party they had the other night. In all, it made us not want to stay there again. You can excuse one as just chance and then 2 in a row means something is wrong there. Maybe we should have changed rooms, but you would think that charging $148 a night would be enough for them to make sure that they get an exterminator there. I would have loved to have a great nights sleep, but wondering what could be living under my bed was not good. The second night of finding one left us with a bad taste in our mouths. I read reviews about this place and thought to give it a chance. My partner and I wanted to stay there for PRIDE weekend, but we're better off staying at an overpriced motel that at least will keep bugs out.

Reviews.Title: “Just a dump”
Reviews.Author: mwprivat
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this dump last year. I booked it through the official website and it looked good on the pages and I liked the price and the free internet. When we arrived, they even upgraded us to a suite, because we booked for four nights. But as soon as we saw the rooms, we decided, we needed to change hotels. This place is a dump, the carped stinks, the rooms were wet and even the internet did not work in our room. Never again !

Reviews.Title: “Clean basic accommodation”
Reviews.Author: lumasabe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lafayette for 1 week in April 2007. We booked a poolside room which was old but very clean. The beds were comfy and everything worked. We had plenty of hot water (family of 4) and never ran out. The air conditioning was extremely noisy. The front desk staff are polite but unfriendly - none of them ever cracked a smile once in the whole week we were there! Bar staff and maids were nice and requests for things such as fresh towels were brought to your room almost straight away. Our kids enjoyed the pool but parents should be aware that it is a public pool and quite a few of the locals use it and the bar in the afternoons. Breakfast provided was good with a waffle maker and cereal/toast etc. It was quieter in the breakfast room on weekdays but from Friday onwards it was crowded and hard to get a table - eat early! The Lafayette is in walking distance to quite a few diners/restaurants and we never felt unsafe walking at night back to the hotel after a meal. Coco's Bakery Restaurant is probably the best to get a good meal at a reasonable price. Overall our stay at the Lafayette was good and it provided a good base with all we needed for our family holiday. We stayed there for one more night at the end of our holiday in a different poolside room and it was just the same as our first one - old but very clean and comfortable. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel sucked!”
Reviews.Author: chiil23
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel i've ever stayed at. I wish i would have visited tripadvisor prior to going. The hotel is very old and worn out. The room was filthy. The hotel staff looked as miserable working there as i did staying there. They were very unfriendly and in serious need of etiquette training. It's bad enough to stay in a dump like this, but to have a staff as uncaring as they were made it even worse. The pictures online are very deceiving. This hotel should be condemned. There was not one single thing pleasant about this hotel that i can think of. My advice to all who may be considering a stay at this hotel...stay away! Proceed at your own risk. You could not pay me to stay at that decrepit dump again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hated it!”
Reviews.Author: rosieb45
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Lafayette Hotel was not friendly or professional in any way. If you do not need hot water, air conditioning, that works, and a staff that actually tries to control their rowdy guests then this is the place for you. The room next to ours was rented to at least 8 Spring Breakers. They screamed and yelled all night until around 3AM. Between banging on the walls, trying to get into our room via the pass door and other assorted nonsense we didn't get a night's sleep. At one point we were thinking of calling the police. The screams sounded more like an attack in progress than partying. We were there on business which made it worse. I called the front desk the next morning and no apologies were offered. I called Orbitz for a refund which I was promptly given and found a beautiful professionally run hotel in downtown San Diego. This hotel may have been something in it's day but it needs a complete make-over and a new staff! The only decent thing there was the "Red Foxx Room" Great steaks and very nice wait staff.

HotelInfo.Name: Lafayette Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 2223 El Cajon Boulevard, San Diego, CA 92104
